text: - In AWS, particularly in data centers,
we get to do fun stuff.
- Our role is to protect the people,
the data, and the assets.
- My role is to maintain servers
and networking devices, which empower

how much capacity we
can offer our customers.
- I'm moreso walking around the building,

maintaining it to make
sure that everything
is running properly.
- One day I could be doing installs,

the next day I could
be dealing with racks.
- For my position, there's a lot
of focus on the infrastructure
in terms of power and cooling.
- [Noha] We get to go around, fix things,
do things with our hands.
It really is hands-on operations work.
- My main role is about technical-related
mechanical electrical systems.
We're not just limited to that.

- I'm at the forefront
of delivering capacity
to our customers, and that helps

AWS ensure the digital
infrastructure of tomorrow.
(upbeat music)
- At the beginning, I was afraid
to not having enough experience to apply.
- I didn't have a data center background.
Didn't know what a server rack was.
- You don't need to be on the spot
in the power to join AWS.
- There was even one tech we hired
that was a butcher for 20 years
before he joined us.
- I just needed to try,
so I try and it paid off.

- [Lou] It doesn't matter
where you come from at AWS.

- [Atilade] We seek
diversity and knowledge
of people from all background.
- AWS is very inclusive and diversity
is definitely celebrated.

- I'm a young black lady
and I'm coming from France.

- It's really nice to be
able to connect with others.
- Like, you feel it's bigger than you.
- Definitely join AWS because we
are not like any other company.
AWS gives us the tools and support
that helps us change the world around us.
(upbeat music)
- Every single person in the company
seeks for that growth in terms
of caring, not only our customers,
but to the world, to the environment.
- AWS also gives us the autonomy

to have a greater impact
in the world around us.
(upbeat music)
